item.description: Note: This schedule is tentative and subject to change (2019-12-04). date lesson instructor slides materials reading HW due 2020-01-17 course overview Earl; Tarrant 2020-01-24 version control Earl 2020-01-31 reproducible research best practices Earl 2020-02-07 introduction to R Earl 2020-02-14 tidyverse Earl 2020-02-21 Rmarkdown Earl 2020-02-28 collaboration with GitHub; more R Earl R assignment (Feb 24) 2020-03-06 databases Earl Rmd assignment (Mar 2) 2020-03-13 spring break 2020-03-20 databases Earl 2020-03-27 data management plans Tarrant 2020-04-03 metadata and publishing Earl databases assignment (Mar 30) 2020-04-10 metadata and publishing Earl DMP assignment (Apr 6) 2020-04-17 managing projects in R; Git branching Earl DMP review (Apr 13) data publishing (Apr 13) 2020-04-24 special topic TBD data publishing review (Apr 20) 2020-05-01 wrap up Earl; Tarrant

item.title: Policies
item.description: Instructors Stevan Earl (stevan.earl@asu.edu) Philip Tarrant (philip.tarrant@asu.edu) Office hours Office hours for both instructors are by appointment. Both instructors are on campus most working days and times, and students are welcome and encouraged to schedule appointments. Course description The effective management of research data is a challenge for researchers in all fields of study. Federal funding agencies require that proposals contain data management plans and many journals now insist data is publicly available prior to publication of your research.
